intro: Manihot cujabensis, commonly known as the Cujabensis arrowleaf, is a species of flowering plant native to South America, particularly found in regions of Brazil and Venezuela. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its large, arrow-shaped leaves that can reach up to 30 centimeters in length. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in clusters, and it is often found in moist, tropical environments. While not widely cultivated, it has been studied for its potential medicinal properties and ecological role in its native habitat.
